headline: Bank of America, Citigroup Weigh New Credit Cards With 10% Rate
summary: Bank of America and Citigroup are exploring options they could offer up as an olive branch to satisfy President Donald Trump's demand to cap credit card interest rates at 10% for one year. Saul Martinez, Head of US Financials Research at HSBC says that the proposed 10% cap on credit card interest rates would be difficult to implement without new legislation and is unlikely to materially change bank profitability in the near term. He joined the discussion on "Bloomberg Markets" with Scarlet Fu.

He joined the discussion on "Bloomberg Markets" with Scarlet Fu.

headline: Trump's call for a 10% credit card rate cap is 'inconceivable'
summary: Trump called on Congress to implement a 10% cap on credit card interest rates, but Wolfe Research head of US policy and politics Tobin Marcus says that the odds of the cap coming to fruition are "essentially zero," highlighting unintended consequences for consumers. Marcus tells Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman that some of the other affordability-focused efforts that Trump has called for — like banning large institutional investors from buying single-family homes — and the Credit Card Competition Act are unlikely, but not "inconceivable" like the credit card rate cap. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Bank of America, Citi Weighing New Credit Cards With 10% Rate
summary: Bank of America and Citigroup are exploring options they could offer up as an olive branch to satisfy President Donald Trump's demand to cap credit card interest rates at 10% for one year. Katherine Doherty reports on Bloomberg Television.

headline: Bank of America, Citigroup consider new credit cards with 10% rate, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Jan 22 (Reuters) - Bank of America and Citigroup are considering options to offer new credit cards with an interest rate cap of 10% to satisfy President Donald Trump's demands, Bloomberg News reported

headline: Earnings Estimates Keep Increasing: A Closer Look
summary: The Q4 earnings season is off to a solid start, with the growth pace accelerating and most management teams painting a stable-to-positive outlook for their businesses.

headline: How Citigroup’s Mixed 2025 Results and 80% Complete Overhaul Will Impact Citigroup (C) Investors
summary: Citigroup recently reported fourth-quarter 2025 and full-year 2025 results showing higher net interest income year over year but lower quarterly net income, while advancing a multiyear overhaul that management says is now more than 80% complete. The bank’s mixed earnings outcome, cost pressures and transformation progress update are drawing attention to how effectively Citigroup can reshape its operations and profitability profile.
